translation:
Piratini, October 31, 1841.

This letter is solely to inquire about your health and that of my comadre. On the 24th of the current month, I wrote to you by mail, and I believe it would have been delivered; there is no news here, only that a letter for the Lord has arrived, which they say is from Rio Grande, carried by a Barbosa from Passo das Pedras.

It was also said that the camels were in Pelotas; however, as far as I know, there is no one here yet; it is true that at the chapel of the Thieves, a group appeared, and according to reports, they caught two young men, one of whom is said to be a son of a Macedo, and they claim they joined the infantry.

Your comadre sends her best regards to Your Excellency.

Most Illustrious and Excellent Sir Domingos José de Almeida. Most Worthy Bagé.

Answered on November 5, 1841.
